title: fix(template): Missing dev dependency react-refresh on TauriJS
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

When generating a TauriJS project with react template, installing its dependencies and running it with the command `npm/pnpm/bun/etc run tauri dev` the development dependency react-refresh jumps with an error because it is not referenced in the project and consequently in the package.json of the template when generating the project. This PR adds that dependency to all TauriJS related templates to eliminate the error.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29b78877-0fe2-40a5-9141-d8f1c79dd38b)

title: fix(template): fix tauri hardcoded lib names
body:
**Description:**

Currently, when creating a Tauri project, the reference to the `lib.rs` file is lost due to the hardcoded name such as `react_lib::run()`, `svelte_lib::run()`, etc. instead of `my_app_lib::run()` which causes a compilation problem when building or starting the project through Tauri and to correct it, you have to manually change the project name to retrieve that reference.

This PR replaces all hardcoded framework-specific library references in the `main.rs` files with the same `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()` placeholder that's already used in `Cargo.toml`. This ensures that during project creation, both the library definition and its usage will consistently use the project name provided by the user.

This change improves the Farm development experience by ensuring consistency across the generated project, making the code more intuitive and maintainable for users.

This pull request includes changes to multiple template files in the `create-farm-rs` crate to standardize the library name used in the `main.rs` files. The library name has been replaced with a placeholder `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib` to ensure consistency across different templates.

Changes to standardize library names:

* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/preact/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `preact_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.
* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/react/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `react_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.
* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/solid/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `solid_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.
* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/svelte/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `svelte_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.
* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/vanilla/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `vanilla_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.
* [`crates/create-farm-rs/templates/tauri2/vue/src-tauri/src/main.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-343c2f4290acc7717373f75d00a1975ea99f04d7bdce19c2e876e5e7099ff1d3L5-R5): Replaced `vue_lib::run()` with `<FARM-TEMPLATE-NAME>_lib::run()`.<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Refactor**
	- Streamlined application startup across multiple templates by switching to a dynamic library reference, enhancing flexibility for template customization.
- **Chores**
	- Removed a markdown file documenting minor version updates for various packages in the FarmFE ecosystem.
	- Deleted a substantial list of dependencies previously marked for patching, improving maintainability of the project.
- **New Features**
	- Introduced a new file documenting a patch for the "create-farm-plugin" and "create-farm".
- **Bug Fixes**
	- Updated dependency versions for `@farmfe/cli` and `@farmfe/core` across multiple templates, ensuring access to the latest features and improvements.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: feat: cache module metadata & cacheable deserialize
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

module metadata cache（Replace write_plugin_cache, plugin_cache_loaded）

1. module metadata cache
```rs
// write cache
context.write_module_matedata(module_id, name, value)

// read cache
context.read_mdoule_matedata(module_id, name)

```


2. Cacheable deserialize_bytes remove unused self param
```rs
module.deserialize_bytes(bytes);
// =>
Module::deserialize_bytes(bytes);
```

3. combine cache item to files

The cached content will be allocated to some files based on the name, with a maximum of 16 files in total.

https://github.com/farm-fe/farm/pull/2082/files#diff-93e90e2f791f9d64f51ed1c604bd2ad5303e41d37d243f9a05ebd3bbe98b7275R74

```rs
    sha256(name.as_bytes(), 32)
      .chars()
      .fold(0u8, |r, i| (r + i as u8) % 16)
```

4. merge store

Combine module, plugin, and custom store into one

5. store add shutdown fn

title: fix(plugin_resolve): duplicated querystring on external
body:
**Description:**
* When I externalize dependencies with querystring, the query duplicates.
* For example:
	* `import { Astal } from 'gi://Astal?version=4.0`
	* with externalizing `['^gi://']`
	* yields `import { o } from "gi://Astal?version=4.0?version=4.0";`


**Reproduction:**
<details>

```diff
diff --git a/farm.config.js b/farm.config.js
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..aaa84db
--- /dev/null
+++ b/farm.config.js
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+import { defineConfig } from '@farmfe/core';
+
+export default defineConfig({
+	compilation: {
+		input: { index: './index.js' },
+		output: { targetEnv: 'library' },
+		external: ['^gi://']
+	},
+});
diff --git a/index.js b/index.js
new file mode 100644
```
